page.title: 03Family day in Roehampton
page.content: 7.a.m.Husband and elder son Michael(19) get up, have breakfast. 7.30,Husband leaves to drive to work in Fulham. 8.00 Michael drives to work.8.00,Jeremy(16) leaves to catch a bus to school. 8.45, I(Mother) leave for work at Roehampton Library. 2.p.m.I finish work and shop locally for fresh bread and vegetables. Main food shopping is done weekly at Putney supermarket. 4.30,Jeremy arrives home from school,we have coffee,he does homework. 5.30,Prepare dinner to eat at 6.30. 6.00, Husband arrives home. Michael is playing cricket for the local team. 7.p.m. Jeremy goes to Youth Club where he can play table-tennis, snooker,listen to records and meet his friends.We see our own friends at week- ends. We spend week nights quietly at home or occasionally visit the cinema in Putney.We run to keep fit. Jeremy works Saturdays for pocket money.
